title: Family Register Sampler, 1833
medium:
Medium: silk and cotton embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Wrought by Abigail Barnard Pittsfield Mass. 1833
provenance:
By 1941, Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
1941, Museum for the Arts of Decoration of the Cooper Union
creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
description:
Family Record giving the dates of birth, marriage and death of members of the Barnard family. At the top, two octagonal cartouches with blue grounds are separated by a basket of fruit and birds. The primary information is arranged in a table with columns of pink, white and tan. Two square cartouches at the bottom with blue grounds and a basket of fruit between, contain a verse: 

Time flies a Pace
In ceaseless race
Man hurries to the tomb
In bliss or woe
Ere long to know
His everlasting doom

Then let thy heart
Who ere thou art
To wisdoms way incline
Use well this hour
While in thy Power
For the next may not be thine

With a strawberry vine border  and  inscription. 

The death date for the second Abigail Barnard (daughter) has been written in with ink "Oct. 2. 1885" Several of the dates are later than the date given in the signature.

tombstone.epitaph:
Family Register Sampler, 1833.
1833. Medium: silk and cotton embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe. 1941-69-19.
